page.title: 09NEWSPAPERS
page.content: Many of the daily happenings, concerns and interests of local people are summed up in the pages of the weekly 'Brecon and Radnor Express'.It costs 20p and has changed little since being established in 1890. Most farms do not have a daily newspaper as there is not enough time to read it every day.Daily news comes in from radio, television and the local 'grape-vine'. Every week sports news, inter-town cricket, football, badminton, golf, tennis and darts matches are reported and commented on in the B+R. Ads for jobs, cars and sales, public notices and entertainments take up most space. Small ads for domestic appliances, animals and skills are important. The first page is taken up by auctioneers adverts, reflecting the importance of farming to the economy and life of the area.
